A new development team requires workstations hosted in a PaaS to develop a new website. Members of the team also require remote access to the workstations using their corporate email addresses. Which of the following solutions will best meet these requirements? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
1️⃣ C. Integrate Identity services

Since the team needs remote access using their corporate email addresses, integrating Identity services (e.g., Azure AD, Okta, AWS IAM) will enable SSO (Single Sign-On) and centralized access management.
This ensures secure authentication and authorization without requiring separate credentials.
2️⃣ D. Implement a VDI solution

A Virtual Desktop Infrastructure (VDI) in a PaaS environment allows developers to access their workstations remotely.
It provides scalability, centralized management, and security, making it ideal for a development team working in a cloud-hosted environment.

choices.A: Roll back the development pipeline to revert and reapply the changes.
choices.D: Update the policies on the CASB to allow access to the test environment.

choices.B: Confirm that the deployment has been completed in the QA environment.

discussion.content:

Before taking any drastic action, the first step is to verify whether the deployment actually reached the QA (testing) environment.

questions.question_text: A cloud engineer needs to perform a database migration. The database has a restricted SLA and cannot be offline for more than ten minutes per month. The database stores 800GB of data, and the network bandwidth to the CSP is 100MBps. Which of the following is the best option to perform the migration?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Explanation:
To minimize downtime and meet the strict SLA (≤10 min/month of downtime), the best approach is to:

1️⃣ Set up a replica database in the cloud.
2️⃣ Synchronize data continuously between the current (on-prem) database and the cloud database.
3️⃣ Switch over to the cloud database when synchronization is complete.

This ensures minimal downtime (just the time it takes to redirect traffic to the new database).

The issue here is buffer overflows and packet drops, which are causing audio lag during phone conferences. Since the budget does not allow for new hardware, the best solution is to prioritize VoIP traffic using Quality of Service (QoS) rules.

QoS helps by:
✔ Prioritizing VoIP packets over less time-sensitive data (e.g., web browsing, file downloads).
✔ Reducing jitter and latency, ensuring smooth real-time communication.
✔ Preventing packet loss by ensuring voice traffic gets priority through network bottlenecks.

Selected Answer: B
B. Configure QoS rules for VoIP traffic.
